channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: About 3/4 street lights are out on the even side of the road, 24th February
item.description:
They have been out since Sunday evening, we had a mini power cut/flicker of lights and then streets lights went out. The road is extremely dark and could be dangerous for people walking down and could also encourage car theft attempts.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lewis Road, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned road signs, 24th February
item.description:
Please remove. Heavy

item.title: Untaxed no MOT abandoned in disabled bay, 24th February
item.description:

item.title: Rubbish in Colworth Grove, 24th February
item.description:
Lots of rubbish has been dumped. Some in black bags and a lot of builders rubbish from the works taking place at Char Chicken on Walworth Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colworth Grove, Walworth, Greater London

item.title: Two lights on Kenmure/Mare street passage both broken., 24th February
item.description:
Both lights on the pedestrian passage between Kenmure Road and mare street are broken, leading to it becoming a bit of a hive of nefarious deeds.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kenmure Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: All out - three or more street lights in a row

item.title: Idling car for an hour, 24th February
item.description:
I live on the second floor and could hear the loud engine running for over an hour. This incident happened around 10 pm. It was extremely loud and disruptive in the evening.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 127-129, Cleveland Street, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light still not working, 24th February
item.description:
I previously reported this issue a few weeks ago (8499693 & 8470025) and you informed me on 21/02/26 the issue had been fixed. Sadly the street light is still not working which is very dangerous for the public when walking at night. Please resolve ASAP.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairfield Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green commercial rack on bagshott street, 24th February
item.description:
A large commercial metal shelving unit has been flytipped on a planting patch on Bagshot street across from the commercial units today. The shelves had been previously chained for the last few months/years to the shop Graces Palace as shown in an earlier image from as recently as 11 Feb.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Bagshot Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London

item.title: Household bins constantly on pavement, 24th February
item.description:

item.title: Broken pavement, 24th February
item.description:
Broken paving slabs all along Walton Road, making the walk to school dangerous. Children are regularly tripping and hurting themselves.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 113, Walton Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, Greater London

item.title: Pothole, 24th February

This pothole has been here for ages and has now damaged my vehicle. Please get it fixed

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Braddyll Street, Greenwich

item.title: Tree seriously damaged by lorry, 24th February
item.description:
A lorry carrying scaffolding virtually destroyed this 20-year old tree that has been cared by the local community since it was planted by Hackney. The company should respond for this. They installed scaffolding outside 47 Prince George Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Prince George Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Long, deep pothole beside the bus stop nr shops in Southwood Road., 24th February
item.description:
I’m sure you are already aware of the appalling road condition by the bus stop. Passengers often have to alight away from a safe kerb as cars are always parked both ends. It’s unbelievable that you have allowed this to go on for so long, an accident waiting to happen.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwood Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet
